intro: Chazaliella oddonii var. cameroonensis, commonly known as the Cameroon chazaliella, is a flowering plant native to Cameroon. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
